title: Female Viagra or Not, You’ll Want to Get Between These Sheets
text:
Now that Addyi, the so-called female version of Viagra, has the stamp of approval from the FDA, everyone’s got an opinion—advocates say it’s a leap forward for women’s rights and sexual dysfunction, critics think it’s not effective enough and makes a joke out of pharmaceutical lobbying. If your stance happens to be somewhere in the middle of the issue, here’s another way of looking at things: It might be a great time to update your sheets, either to sleep in or get busy between. Whether you pop the “little pink pill” or not in the coming season, here are four amazing start-up, online-only bedding labels to peruse.

Boll & Branch

Founded by a husband and wife team last year, Boll & Branch sells sheets made of cotton sourced directly from local farmers around the world. Their sustainable linens come in simple whites, ivories, blues, and grays, with banded, pleated, and vintage-inspired trim.

Parachute

Manufactured in Tuscany, Parachute is focused on careful design—from its oversize cashmere throws that cover an entire bed, to its envelope closures on pillowcases. The company also partners with the United Nations Foundation’s Nothing But Nets antimalaria campaign. The designs are minimal and modern, with materials that range from sateen to linen.

Crane & Canopy

This bedding site works directly with manufacturers who are also in business with top luxury department stores, offering similar products at much lower costs. Crane & Canopy offers the widest range of styles and colors of the start-up bunch.

Brooklinen

Brooklinen's offerings are made with neutral color palettes, like navy, gray, and white, and its sheet patterns only go as far as a thin pinstripe or window pane. The allure of this brand is certainly its technique and use of long-staple Egyptian cotton, which produces sheets and comforters that are softer than most.
description: The FDA has just approved the first female libido pill—maybe it’s time to consider buying some new bedding.
